intro: Acrostichum laurentii, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, lowland areas and thrives in humid, warm climates. It is often found in swamps, marshes, and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for tropical gardens and conservation efforts.
